answers.answer: I'm also 15w. and too, get that quesy yet not ready to throw up feeling if I don't snack.  Lately I love to nibble on Hummos and pita bread (chick peas are good).  There are others but I have to go right now, I'll catch ya later!  Godd luck w/food ideas.  I'm interested in what others are all chowing down on these days!

Fresh fruit, yogurt, lunch meat (yes, I ate it when I was pregger), cheese, nuts, granola bar, edamame (my favorite), etc. for snacks.For meals, make lasagna and freeze in individual portiion, any kind of soup and do the same.  Any cassarole, and some pasta dish you can freeze.  I bought a lot of already cooked chicken breast strips and put it in a salad with avacado.

i am just pregnant and have started w/ a lil nausea.  i also had gestational diabetes last time around so i am watching now.  my fave snacks are cheese sticks or cheese and crackers.  apples and peanut butter.  yogurt.  salad w/ olives.  nuts.  and i love avocado too....yummm, i grill that w/ a bit of olive oil and eat w/ a tiny side of pasta.

I love eating all kinds of cereals right from the box, no bowl or milk. Plus I eat protein or fruit/nut bars or protein shakes (watch the calories, though, some of them are high). Also, microwave popcorn is good. Oh, and I'm addicted to Subway sandwiches on wheat- the veggie or veggie burger.

Hi, I'm back!  Lately I love the freshness of a cream cheese bagel w/ fresh local cuc's & tomatoes & avocado.  I love yogurt, almonds, salmon salad w/ lettuce, peppers.  For meals, I try to make large quanitities like spaghetti, hamburger/mac casserole, tuna casserole.  We eat some for dinner and then freeze the rest for another meal.  For weekend meals, like Sunday, we'll bbq a steak (that way the hubby can help) and make a huge veggy salad (coleslaw, greek (minus the feta), cucmber/tomatoe etc.) so it can marinade and then be used for leftovers the next day.

when my m/s finally subsided, i would make a nice pasta salad and keep it in the fridge to pick at whenever i was hungry. i made sure to load it with lots of fresh, raw veggies like tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, etc... to make it more nutritional. i also loved cubing mozzarella into it since i needed to get more calcium. it made a great snack or lunch by itself, or a great side dish to any leftover meat we had. you can vary the dressing to make it seem more interesting too. i loved using bottled balsamic dressings.
Ladies -- thanks for all the suggestions...everything sounds so good!  I'm going shopping 'cause I'm hungry now!!!

question: Hi everyone.  I am 15w pregnant and my morning sickness has subsided -- yeah!I seem to get hungry every couple of hours, but can only eat about 1/2 of a "normal" meal.  I'm getting tired of making something so often, but feel sick (not as bad as m/s) if I don't eat every 2-3 hours.I'm also a little bored with what to eat...would you all give me some suggestions on what you eat -- and things I can make more of just to heat up.  I feel like I'm really in a rut...As always, I appreciate all your feedback.  Best to all!!!
title: Ideas for snacks,, dinner, etc.
